intro: Cylindrosolenium sprucei, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and its flowers are usually greenish-white with a faintly colored lip. Cylindrosolenium sprucei is a rare and specialized species, often found in specific microhabitats at high elevations.
